segment.source: Updates and resetting the device
segment.target: Updates and resetting the device

segment.source: Updates and resetting the device
segment.target: Updates and resetting the device

segment.source: Updates and resetting the device
segment.target: Updates and resetting the device

segment.source: OEMs must consider how updates are affected when the user resets the device.
segment.target: OEMs must consider how updates are affected when the user resets the device.

segment.source: To understand the fundamentals of how resetting the device alters the operating system, carefully review Resetting the device.
segment.target: To understand the fundamentals of how resetting the device alters the operating system, carefully review Resetting the device.

segment.source: OS and BSP updates
segment.target: OS and BSP updates

segment.source: Microsoft OS and OEM Board Support Package (BSP) updates—and any associated registry changes—persist after the device is reset.
segment.target: Microsoft OS and OEM Board Support Package (BSP) updates—and any associated registry changes—persist after the device is reset.

segment.source: For the user, this means that updates do not need to be downloaded when the device is reset.
segment.target: For the user, this means that updates do not need to be downloaded when the device is reset.

segment.source: For the OEM, this means that newer versions of the OS and BSP updates need to be designed to allow compatibility with older apps, whose updates reverted when the device is reset.
segment.target: For the OEM, this means that newer versions of the OS and BSP updates need to be designed to allow compatibility with older apps, whose updates reverted when the device is reset.

segment.source: Preloaded apps
segment.target: Preloaded apps

segment.source: When the device is reset, preloaded apps install from the current version of the XAP that is stored on the phone.
segment.target: When the device is reset, preloaded apps install from the current version of the XAP that is stored on the phone.

segment.source: The current version is either the original XAP that shipped on the device or the most recent version that was received in an OEM over-the-air (OTA) update.
segment.target: The current version is either the original XAP that shipped on the device or the most recent version that was received in an OEM over-the-air (OTA) update.

segment.source: The user may still need to download updates to the apps, if later versions have been published to the Store but have not been delivered as part of an OTA update.
segment.target: The user may still need to download updates to the apps, if later versions have been published to the Store but have not been delivered as part of an OTA update.

segment.source: There are additional important considerations for updating preloaded system setting apps.
segment.target: There are additional important considerations for updating preloaded system setting apps.

segment.source: For more info, see System settings apps and updates.
segment.target: For more info, see System settings apps and updates.

segment.source: Placeholder apps
segment.target: Placeholder apps

segment.source: Placeholder apps are reinstalled from the current app package on the device.
segment.target: Placeholder apps are reinstalled from the current app package on the device.

segment.source: The current version is either the original package that shipped on the device or the most recent version that was received as part of an OTA update.
segment.target: The current version is either the original package that shipped on the device or the most recent version that was received as part of an OTA update.

segment.source: User apps and data
segment.target: User apps and data

segment.source: Any user-installed Store apps and associated data are removed when the device is reset.
segment.target: Any user-installed Store apps and associated data are removed when the device is reset.

segment.source: The user can use the backup and restore feature to restore these apps.
segment.target: The user can use the backup and restore feature to restore these apps.

segment.source: For more info, see Back up my stuff.
segment.target: For more info, see Back up my stuff.

segment.target: Related topics
